item.title: James Watson, co-discoverer of DNA's double helix, dead at 97
item.description: James Watson, the controversial American biologist whose 1953 discovery of the structure of DNA ushered in the age of genetics, has died.

item.title: Mildura council aims to take Melbourne's controversial Yellow Peril art in new tourism campaign
item.description: Mildura Rural City Council says it wants Melbourne's Yellow Peril art piece to be moved to the regional centre as part of a new tourism campaign.

item.title: Feral cat eradication on Christmas Island clashes with Malay culture
item.description: On a speck of land in the Indian Ocean, one of the world's most ambitious wars is being waged against feral cats. But not everyone is celebrating.

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka to face Elena Rybakina in WTA Finals title decider
item.description: World number one Aryna Sabalenka books a showdown with Elena Rybakina, with both players eyeing off their first season-ending championship win.

item.title: Albury's Macquarie Textiles celebrated for decades of manufacturing
item.description: Textile manufacturing took Albury's work to the Opera House, federal parliament, the Olympics and beyond.

item.title: Plan to save sacred Millstream aquifer welcomed amid water sustainability concerns
item.description: With sacred springs and water holes in northern WA drying up, the WA government decides to relocate where it is extracting groundwater from.

item.title: New Zealand's Shanice Parker to face Australia in Pacific Cup final in Sydney
item.description: Shanice Parker is the daughter of a Jillaroos World Cup player, but meeting her biological father as a teenager has prompted her to represent New Zealand.

item.title: Israel identifies latest hostage body as Lior Rudaeff, as families await five more
item.description: Five deceased Israeli hostages are yet to be returned as part of the ceasefire agreement with Hamas.

item.title: Australia secure 3-0 Ashes whitewash with 22-point win over England in third Test
item.description: The Kangaroos have secured a 3-0 Ashes victory with Harry Grant leading the way in a big win over England at Headingley.

item.title: Wallabies fall to Italy 26-19 in Udine Test to record consecutive defeats
item.description: The Wallabies slump to consecutive defeats on their spring tour, as Italy comes from behind to win in Udine.

item.title: How the dismissal of Gough Whitlam's Labor government in 1975 was sealed by the Senate
item.description: Before Gough Whitlam's dismissal and famous speech on the steps of Parliament House, there was silence — and strategy — in the Senate. This is the inside story of how a budget stand-off changed Australian democracy forever.

item.title: Developers being forced to build affordable housing could ease rental market
item.description: Carrie-Ann is now cooking in her own kitchen thanks to a mandatory affordable housing contribution scheme.

item.title: 'World's first sex worker statue' returns home after 30 years
item.description: Joy, a sculpture by artist Loui May, was erected in Sydney's Darlinghurst in the late 1990s. After hundreds signed a petition for its return, a bronze version was created and placed in the spot it once stood decades ago.

item.title: Samoan fans line the streets of Apia ahead of match against New Zealand
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Pacific, pride, and pancakes with Papa's father-in-law
item.description: The passion of the Pacific shines through in Samoa's rugby league team, and the pride the people have is evident on the island.

item.title: Elena Rybakina defeats Aryna Sabalenka to win WTA Finals and collect record prize money
item.description: Elena Rybakina has defeated world number one Aryna Sabalenka to win the season-ending WTA Finals, 6-3, 7-6(0).

item.title: Students, teaching staff face challenges amid Adelaide University merger
item.description: From late next month, the University of Adelaide and the University of South Australia will begin to cease operations and transform to become Adelaide University. But as the clock ticks, some students and staff are feeling the pressure.

item.title: New food safety rules for produce in Tasmania have smaller growers worried
item.description: The new regulations would bring Tasmania into line with national standards, but smaller growers are worried they will have to pay the same fees and meet the same auditing requirements as large-scale growers.

item.title: Women's pain inquiry finds Victorians' suffering worsened by male-centred healthcare system
item.description: A Victorian inquiry has found a dismissive and disrespectful healthcare system centred around men is contributing to poorer outcomes for women and girls.

item.title: Wallabies lament poor performance in 26-19 Test rugby loss to Italy
item.description: Wallabies captain Harry Wilson says he is "hurting" after Australia's 26-19 loss to Italy, while coach Joe Schmidt is lamenting his side's "flat performance".

item.title: Bragg pledges to do ‘right thing’ if Liberal party scraps net zero commitment
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: The J Awards has been loud and proud about Australian music for 20 years
item.description: The centrepiece of triple j's Ausmusic Month celebrations, the J Awards is celebrating its 20th anniversary in 2025. Here's how it all began.

item.title: Annemarie Manders reflects on 35 years as a lavender farmer in the Yarra Valley
item.description: Annemarie Manders reflects on how she became a lavender farmer in the Yarra Valley.

item.title: Feelings of failure and being unseen. What it's like to be a stepmum
item.description: There is no road map for step-parenting, and experts say a common mistake is assuming it will be easy.

item.title: AFLW finals: Brisbane Lions beat Melbourne by 13 points to reach prelim final, Adelaide beats St Kilda
item.description: Brisbane defeats Melbourne for the first time in AFLW finals, as the Lions win on the road to clinch a preliminary final spot, and Adelaide ends St Kilda's season.

item.title: Cook Islands qualify for Rugby League World Cup, beating South Africa 58-6 in Sydney
item.description: Cook Islands book their spot in a fourth Rugby League World Cup, turning it on to beat South Africa 58-6 in Sydney.

item.title: Majority of Australia's first Ashes Test squad to feature in Sheffield Shield round four
item.description: Fourteen members of Australia's 15-man squad for the first Ashes Test will take part in this week's Sheffield Shield fixtures, while England will play an intra-squad game in Perth.

item.title: New Zealand defeats Samoa 36-14 to claim Pacific Cup and farewell Kieran Foran in style
item.description: New Zealand overturns an eight-point half-time deficit to defeat Samoa 36-14 and claim its second Pacific Cup.

item.title: Why the Pacific Championship final should be a look into rugby league's future
item.description: New Zealand stopped Samoa from making history in the Pacific Championship final but the match was a tantalising reminder of what's possible for rugby league in the days to come.

item.title: From jackaroo to 'Golden Tonsils' radio titan: the life and career of John Laws
item.description: John Laws, also known as "Golden Tonsils", spent a mammoth 71 years on air at stations such as Sydney's 2UE and 2SM, before retiring in November 2024.

item.title: Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin's remains return to Israel
item.description: Hamas hands over Hadar Goldin's remains as part of its ceasefire agreement with Israel.

item.title: Alex de Minaur defeated in ATP Finals by Carlos Alcaraz 7-6(5), 6-2
item.description: Top seed Carlos Alcaraz began his bid for a first ATP Finals trophy with a 7-6(5), 6-2 win over Australian Alex de Minaur in their round-robin clash at the season-ending championships in Turin on Sunday.

item.title: Tassal suffers fish kill at barramundi farm in WA's Cone Bay amid expansion plans
item.description: Foreign-owned aquaculture company Tassal suffers a fish kill at its barramundi farm in WA's Cone Bay, where the company has plans to expand.

item.title: Victoria's Wurundjeri people file native title claim for Melbourne
item.description: The Wurundjeri Woi-wurrung people in Victoria have filed a native title claim with the Federal Court, seeking recognition over country that spans much of Melbourne.

item.title: Crime rise at Melbourne shopping centres sparks calls for action
item.description: Crime has increased at several major Melbourne shopping centres with concerned communities calling for more action.

item.title: Liberal decision on net zero unlikely to resolve bitter internal divide
item.description: As Liberals descend on Canberra to settle a climate policy, conservatives and moderates remain opposed on the question of net zero, threatening a deeper rupture.

item.title: Are Australia and its rare earths part of the solution to 'magnet shock'?
item.description: Anyone who controls the supply of magnets controls the future, and China has been quietly working on this under America's nose for decades. Can Australia muscle in?

item.title: Time running out for Australia to win the rights to host COP31 in Adelaide
item.description: It is almost crunch time for Australia to secure hosting rights for the next COP meeting, so it is timely to examine why the government's bid is languishing and how it can resolve a long-running stand-off with Türkiye.

item.title: City of Melbourne rejects Mildura's attempt to return 'Yellow Peril' home
item.description: City of Melbourne rejects Mildura's attempt to take the city's controversial "Yellow Peril" sculpture.

item.title: Beyond the Box showcases Australian artists using cardboard to create art
item.description: Artists have been using cardboard for at least a century to create works. These Australians showcase how the humble medium can be transformed into striking sculptures and collage.

item.title: AFL gives teams finishing 10th chance to win premiership through wildcard round in finals
item.description: AFL teams ranked ninth and 10th will be in contention to win the premiership from next season, with the league introducing a wildcard round.

item.title: Respected engineer sounds alarm on extent of defective Darwin apartment buildings
item.description: A respected consulting engineer says about 80 per cent of apartment buildings he has inspected in Darwin have serious structural issues.

item.title: Wallabies 'not looking for excuses' after defeat to Italy
item.description: Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt says his weary charges must toughen up rather than seek excuses after falling to Italy in Udine, ahead of two more severe tests to come.

item.title: Cable car on Kunanyi/Mount Wellington included in draft recommendations, Right to Information documents show
item.description: The Tasmanian government has made a draft recommendation for a cable car on Hobart's Kunanyi/Mount Wellington, documents released under Right to Information laws show.

item.title: Exhibition depicting Geraldton homelessness shown at Canberra's Parliament House
item.description: A portrait exhibition of people who have experienced homelessness is opening up conversations to show everyone has a story worth listening to.

item.title: Why Oscar Piastri was handed a 10-second penalty during the F1 São Paulo Grand Prix
item.description: Oscar Piastri was involved in the biggest flashpoint of the Formula 1 São Paulo Grand Prix, earning him a costly penalty and damaging his chances of winning the drivers' championship.

item.title: More than 2,800 US flights cancelled in a day as government shutdown persists
item.description: More than 2,800 domestic flights are cancelled in the United States over the course of a single day due to an ongoing shortage of air traffic controllers.

item.title: This street is home to two cities with opposite laws and politics
item.description: These two US cities share a name and a main street, but come election time, following the rules on one side of the road could land you in jail on the other.

item.title: US Senate votes in favour of bill to end federal government shutdown
item.description: The US Senate votes in favour of ending the longest government shutdown in the country's history, which has lasted for 40 days.

item.title: Donald Trump booed at NFL game between Washington Commanders and Detroit Lions
item.description: Donald Trump is booed by sections of the crowd as he becomes the first sitting US president to attend a regular-season NFL game in nearly half a century.

item.title: The trams that made Melbourne: Celebrating 140 years since the city's first cable tram
item.description: Melbourne's history with trams goes back 140 years. The city got its first tram in 1885 and the fleet has grown to become the world's largest tram network.

item.title: Mark Parton elected as Canberra Liberals leader as Leanne Castley steps down, Jeremy Hanson resigns as deputy
item.description: There has been a complete shake-up in the leadership of the Canberra Liberals, with Mark Parton elected the new leader after Leanne Castley stepped down earlier this morning.

item.title: The AFL's Wildcard Round has been met with negative reviews, so why does it exist?
item.description: Footy fans are not impressed with the AFL's new finals-extending Wildcard Round, but it is all part of Andrew Dillon's grand plan for total domination of Australian sport.

item.title: On the Myanmar-Thailand border, bombing a scam centre could barely dent the industry
item.description: Myanmar junta bombing of a scam centre is little more than "political theatre" to appease the international community, an expert says.

item.title: Lions are 'unrelenting' and yet again the underdogs for this finals series
item.description: The Brisbane Lions secured a spot in their sixth consecutive preliminary with a win over Melbourne on the weekend. Yet with North Melbourne's dominance, the Queenslanders are "underdogs" in the race for the flag once again.

item.title: Thinking about an e-bike or e-scooter for your kid? Here's what's legal and safe
item.description: E-bikes and e-scooters might sound like an exciting gift for a teenager or child, but experts say there are several things to consider before buying one.

item.title: A leaked memo brought down two senior BBC bosses — here's what it said
item.description: A leaked memo to the BBC's editorial standards board has dominated headlines in Britain and led to the resignations of two board members. Here's a look at what has happened and how the bosses responded.

item.title: Who is Jay Weatherill, Australia's new high commissioner to the UK?
item.description: Australia's next high commissioner to the United Kingdom's time in politics was defined by consultative leadership, pizza politics and a gatecrashed press conference.

item.title: Measles warning issued for South West and Great Southern as confirmed case numbers climb
item.description: Authorities and experts urge people in the state's south to be on alert for measles as the number of community transmission cases continues to climb.

item.title: Monday finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Push for a ban on using ‘doulas’ during childbirth
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Thailand suspends peace deal with Cambodia after landmine blast near border
item.description: The peace deal between the two countries was overseen by US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Trump threatens to sue 'corrupt' BBC for $1.5b over 'salacious' documentary
item.description: Lawyers for the US president warn Britain's national broadcaster they are preparing to sue it over "fabricated" statements that aired in its Panorama program last year.

item.title: Infrastructure Victoria calls for upgrade to 'unreliable and infrequent' Upfield train line in Melbourne's north
item.description: In one booming growth area, north of Melbourne, locals are forced to drive to avoid long delays for trains during peak periods. Multiple groups are calling on the state government to upgrade its services.

item.title: A damning memo shows the BBC's issues are bigger than its coverage of Donald Trump
item.description: It is not US President Donald Trump who represents the biggest political threat to the BBC, but a leaked 8,000-word letter of complaint to the broadcaster's board motivated by "despair at inaction".

item.title: The faces with a front-row seat to history
item.description: After Gough Whitlam was sacked, a crowd formed. They could have stormed the building. Fifty years on, this photo tells the story of The Dismissal.

item.title: Why Australia's ironclad future is under threat
item.description: For decades, China has resented being held hostage over the iron ore price by its own insatiable demand and a handful of Australian producers.

item.title: COP30 kicks off 10 years on from the Paris Agreement. Where is the world at?
item.description: It was a moment of euphoria when the world came together to sign a pact on climate action. Ten years on from the 2015 Paris Agreement we managed to shift the needle. But the problem is it's just not happening fast enough.

item.title: US risks AI debt bubble as China faces its 'arithmetic problem', leading analysts warn
item.description: Two leading experts on the world's biggest economies warn both countries face serious challenges, and not just over trade with each other.

item.title: Cardiac patient reveals urgent surgery at Sydney public hospital was cancelled four times
item.description: Ian Parker waited more than three months for urgent heart surgery that should have been done within 30 days. He was inspired to share his story after an ABC investigation.

item.title: Drug drivers involved in more Queensland road fatalities than drunk drivers
item.description: More than 1,000 positive drug tests involving cocaine have been recorded by Queensland Police since the narcotic became part of the state's roadside testing regime as drug driving overtakes drink driving in fatal crashes.

item.title: ACT government seeks legal advice as contractor misses MyWay+ deadline
item.description: The ACT government is seeking legal advice over the botched MyWay+ transport system, as the company tasked with rolling it out missed the deadline to complete the project.

item.title: Micro parties on the rise as discontent with major parties grows in regional NSW
item.description: As voters demand better political representation in the bush, two new micro parties in the NSW Riverina region promise to be a solution.

item.title: Stunning icicle kick by David Rodríguez wins Canadian Premier League final
item.description: A blizzard, a sensational overhead kick goal, snowploughs clearing the pitch for extra time — the Canadian Premier League soccer final had it all.

item.title: Owners barred from Beachport holiday units after council fire safety change
item.description: Meg Longstaff hoped to continue a family tradition of beach holidays this summer, but a council decision on fire safety enforcement means she and other unit owners may be forced to make other plans.

item.title: Hungarian British author David Szalay wins Booker Prize 2025 for his novel Flesh
item.description: Hungarian British author David Szalay bests past winner Kiran Desai and former shortlistee Andrew Miller to win the prestigious Booker Prize for his sixth book, the "extraordinary, singular" Flesh.

item.title: Whitlam Dismissal live from 1975: How it unfolded, 50 years on
item.description: Fifty years ago today, prime minister Gough Whitlam was dismissed by governor-general Sir John Kerr. To mark the anniversary, we're putting you right there as it happened, covering the key moments of that fateful day in 1975 in real time.

item.title: US Supreme Court rejects call to overturn same-sex marriage legalisation
item.description: A former Kentucky court clerk who refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples after a high court's 2015 ruling had been looking to appeal.

item.title: Bush retreat brings together veterans to talk and lighten their load
item.description: Nestled in the foothills of a mountain, a retreat near Rockhampton in central Queensland brings together veterans, their families and others to talk and lighten their load.

item.title: New 'radio map' of the Milky Way reveals where stars are born and die
item.description: The Milky Way appears as a dusty band of stars, but by observing its radio frequencies a different view can be seen, revealing parts of the galaxy hidden from sight.

item.title: Prosecutors drop sexual assault, rape charges against Geelong AFL player Tanner Bruhn
item.description: Lawyers for Geelong AFL player Tanner Bruhn say "false allegations" were made against him and a friend, telling the media the pair have been vindicated in court.

item.title: Charli XCX enlists The Velvet Underground's John Cale for Wuthering Heights collaboration House
item.description: Charli XCX shares an "elegant, brutal" song featuring John Cale, the first for the soundtrack to Emerald Fennell's film adaptation of Wuthering Heights.

item.title: Wallabies desperate to avoid 67-year low on draining end of season Tour of Europe
item.description: After falling to England and Italy, the Wallabies are halfway towards becoming the first Australian tourists since 1958 to lose four straight Tests in Europe.

item.title: Te Maire Martin ready to aid Eli Katoa's recovery, but warns path may not be comparable
item.description: Te Maire Martin knows what it takes to get back on the field after a brain bleed, but warns that Eli Katoa's path is not going to be exactly identical for one reason.

item.title: Prices rising fastest in inner cities and growth towns during expanded 5 per cent deposit scheme
item.description: Inner cities, wealthy suburbs and fast-growing regional centres top the list of house price growth in October, according to a new deep dive focused on homes covered by the 5 per cent deposit scheme.

item.title: Donald Trump hosts landmark meeting with Syrian President Ahmad al-Sharaa in Washington
item.description: Donald Trump praises Syrian President Ahmad al-Sharaa after a landmark White House meeting — the first time a Syrian president has ever visited Washington.

item.title: A motorised hydrofoiler rides well clear of swimmers off Adelaide's metropolitan coastline
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sport Integrity Australia report reveals athletes' and coaches' views on abuse
item.description: A new report from Sport Integrity Australia asks athletes and coaches about the misbehaviour they may have experienced from community levels to the elite standard.

item.title: Magistrate sentences driver following 'highest alcohol reading' she's ever seen
item.description: A Victorian magistrate praises a man's engagement with counselling services during sentencing after being caught with a blood alcohol reading 10 times over the legal limit.

item.title: Non-bank sector in ASIC, RBA's gaze as customers chasing property loans drift their way
item.description: The tapering of super-sized bank profits has shone a spotlight on the growth of the non-bank sector. Regulators have them in sight given the risk they pose to the financial system.

item.title: AI could be the ultimate test of Australia's democracy
item.description: Developing safe AI is not just an opportunity for a democracy like ours; ever since our superpower ally checked out of its responsibilities on this front, it's an obligation.

item.title: Nauruan president makes secretive trip to parliament amid claims bikies won lucrative contract
item.description: Nauru's president has made a secretive visit to Parliament House in Canberra amid allegations that bikie gangs won a lucrative contract to provide security for former immigration detainees.

item.title: Tasmanian parliament to apologise for body parts kept in pathology museum
item.description: The Tasmanian government will apologise for the past practice of retaining body parts after autopsies without the knowledge or consent of family members.

item.title: Canada loses its measles-free status after ongoing outbreaks
item.description: Canada has lost its measles elimination status due to ongoing outbreaks as childhood vaccination rates fall and the highly contagious virus spreads across North and South America.

item.title: I thought I hated basketball. Now it's given me an amazing life
item.description: After breaking her back at 19 Katherine's community made sure she knew how special she was. Wheelchair basketball brought her back to earth and made her life "truly amazing".

item.title: Grounds revealed for State of Western Australia's appeal against abuse survivor Dion Barber's $2.8 million payout
item.description: The State of Western Australia is appealing the entire basis of a judgement which awarded a Perth man nearly $3 million in compensation for abuse he suffered while he was in state care.

item.title: England cricket great Ian Botham concerned by lack of warm-up matches prior to first Ashes Test
item.description: England's only warm-up game prior to the first Ashes Test will be an internal match, a fact that is greatly concerning legendary all-rounder Ian Botham.

item.title: Dozens of patients caught up in medical scan bungle at Caboolture Hospital as review ends
item.description: A major review of medical scans at Caboolture Hospital's outpatient clinic finds 38 patients did not get follow-up care, prompting the health service to apologise again for the bungle.

item.title: Former Darwin real estate agent denied bail after allegedly running over foot of BMW repossession agent
item.description: A Darwin real estate agent accused of running over the foot of a BMW car repossession agent has been refused bail in the Darwin Local Court.

item.title: Childcare centre and supervisors charged after toddler's death outside Darwin
item.description: The Northern Territory government has confirmed a rural Darwin childcare centre and three of its supervisors have been charged after the death of a toddler at the centre in 2023.

item.title: Georgia Wareham's all-round brilliance helps Melbourne Renegades sink Sydney Thunder in WBBL
item.description: Renegades captain Georgia Wareham continues her blistering start to this year's WBBL campaign, scoring a half-century with the bat and picking up two wickets with the ball.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Council discovers 46 trees mistakenly cut down during park redevelopment
item.description: The Town of Victoria Park has revealed nearly 50 trees were removed without authorisation during redevelopment works to a park and adjacent hospitality precinct, and says it is investigating what went wrong.

item.title: Indian anti-terror agency leading probe into Red Fort car explosion in Delhi
item.description: Narendra Modi has described the attack that killed at least eight people as a "conspiracy", vowing to bring those responsible to justice.

item.title: Turkish military cargo plane crashes in Georgia with 20 soldiers killed
item.description: Türkiye's defence ministry confirms 20 Turkish soldiers on board were killed in the crash.

item.title: Future of three Victorian community hospitals up in the air as references wiped from government website
item.description: The Victorian government is refusing to say whether it will build three community hospitals that were originally meant to be completed more than a year ago.

item.title: Nationals nominate hardliner for net zero talks as Liberals meet to settle position
item.description: One of the Nationals' most strident opponents of net zero will attend talks on a final Coalition policy position. Before then, the Liberals must decide their own stance — but conservatives are now confident net zero will be dropped.

item.title: Sussan Ley sees the Coalition's young voter problem but may not survive to offer solutions
item.description: The Coalition risks political extinction unless it can reconnect with younger voters who have abandoned it in droves.

item.title: Are 5 per cent deposits the leg-up first home buyers need, or are they pouring fuel on the fire?
item.description: It will be some time before the full effects of the government's expanded first home buyer support scheme become clear, but young Australians across the country say it is still a tough market.

item.title: Michelle Foster's family feels let down by mental health and justice systems
item.description: Andrea Foster and her son Peter Spiniello continue to feel let down by a system they believe caused the death of their daughter, and sister, who was killed seven years ago by a mentally unwell man.

item.title: Doctors defend emergency department triage policy as 'closing the gap in action'
item.description: Doctors and medical associations have backed a Melbourne hospital's emergency department triage policy to improve care for First Nations patients, describing criticisms of the closing the gap measure as 'opportunistic, uninformed'.

item.title: Indonesia accused of 'twisting facts' as former dictator Suharto named national hero
item.description: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto courts controversy by granting his former father-in-law, the authoritarian dictator Suharto, "national hero" status.

item.title: Black Friday sales set to be biggest on record with shoppers spending billions on deals
item.description: About 6 million Australians are expected to take part in Black Friday sales this year and on average they will fork out $804 each.

item.title: Leo relies on exercise physiology to keep him moving but that could change under NDIS review
item.description: Leo depends on exercise physiology to keep him moving, but there are fears that his progress could be halted under an NDIS review.

item.title: Farmers angry as Woolworths imports US butter in green and gold packaging
item.description: Australia's dairy industry is concerned a US brand, packaged in green and gold with a white colouring and bland flavour, looks as if it's locally made.

item.title: Genea patients want IVF giant held to account as cybersecurity expert raises ongoing concerns
item.description: Patients of fertility giant Genea want the company held to account for a data breach earlier this year, amid concerns that some of its IT systems continue to fall short of best practice.

item.title: Joe Root a new player under Bazball despite previous Ashes struggles in Australia, says batting coach
item.description: England insists Joe Root's lack of centuries in Australia is not an issue, pointing to the fact he has thrived around the world under Brendon McCullum.

item.description: The Liberals have met at Parliament House in Canberra after a marathon meeting to decide on the future of the party's net zero policy.

item.description: A thick cloud of coral spawn has blanketed parts of the Great Barrier Reef this week, signalling a key window for restoration work.

item.title: Dallas Mavericks axe manager behind NBA's shocking Luka Doncic trade
item.description: Nico Harrison, the man behind the most shocking trade in NBA history which saw Luka Doncic head to the Lakers, is fired by the Dallas Mavericks as the move continues to backfire.

item.title: CASA warns of 'zero tolerance' for helicopter safety breaches in wake of Matt Wright trial evidence
item.description: Australia's aviation watchdog has issued a warning to the sector, after accounts of widespread chopper rule-breaking were aired during the trial of Northern Territory croc wrangler Matt Wright.

item.description: Two independent MLCs whose votes are crucial for the proposed Macquarie Point stadium have outlined their concerns about the project in budget reply speeches to parliament.

item.title: Menulog to shut down in two weeks, local shares close down — as it happened
item.description: Food-delivery company Menulog will shut down in two weeks, citing "challenging circumstances", while the Australian share market has closed slightly down. Look back on the day's business and economic news.

item.description: Beau Webster and Matt Renshaw remind selectors of their talents with stand-out performances in the Sheffield Shield on the eve of the Ashes.

item.title: How WA's outgoing Chief Health Officer Andy Robertson once hunted anthrax in Iraq
item.description: For WA's retiring Chief Health Officer Andy Robertson, the 2020 spread of the "novel coronavirus" was not the first time he had been part of a story of global significance — and he also fears the next pandemic could be worse.

item.title: Aboriginal team wins national award for suicide prevention work in Alice Springs
item.description: The Alice Springs team has been rewarded for its culture of listening to reduce high suicide rates in the Northern Territory.

item.title: Vapes reaching country towns across WA despite strengthened laws

item.title: Donald Trump asks Supreme Court to throw out E Jean Carroll abuse finding

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo confirms 2026 World Cup will be his last with retirement looming
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo says the 2026 World Cup will be his last as he plots retirement in the next two years.

item.title: Abuse lawyer slams WA government's decision to appeal Dion Barber's compensation for historical sexual abuse
item.description: A lawyer accuses the WA government of hijacking Dion Barber's $2.85 million compensation case for historical sexual abuse in a bid to "clarify law", instead of legislating it through parliament.

item.title: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price in 'urgent' pre-Christmas 2028 campaign fundraising drive
item.description: Northern Territory senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price is asking supporters to dig deep ahead of the festive season and help bankroll a $125,000 campaign fund three years out from the 2028 federal election.

item.title: Russia loses High Court battle with Commonwealth over Canberra embassy site, but will be compensated
item.description: The lease was granted to Russia in 2008, but was withdrawn when parliament passed a new law citing ASIO advice that the planned embassy could pose a threat to national security.

item.title: Liberal politicians on Qantas plane that made urgent turnaround to Adelaide
item.description: Three Liberal politicians have been delayed getting to Canberra for climate talks after a Qantas plane was forced to make an urgent landing at Adelaide Airport when crews noticed smoke in the cabin.

item.title: BBC boss rallies staff in face of leadership crisis and Trump legal threat
item.description: The outgoing boss of the BBC sought to rally his journalists on Tuesday, as the British broadcaster confronts legal action by US President Donald Trump.

item.title: Alex de Minaur beaten by Lorenzo Musetti but still alive at ATP Finals
item.description: Alex de Minaur's hopes of reaching the ATP Finals semis hang by a thread after a heartbreaking three-set loss to Lorenzo Musetti.

item.title: Spy chief warns of China espionage threat to business, critical infrastructure
item.description: ASIO director-general Mike Burgess urges businesses to protect their data to prepare for possible attacks from hostile states.

item.title: Ruby Gold mango variety to hit Australian supermarket shelves this summer
item.description: The Ruby Gold mango has been produced in commercial quantities for the first time and sellers say they are sure it will be a winner with consumers.

item.title: Sam Kerr scores twice in first club start in 692 days as Chelsea defeat St. Pölten 6-0 in the Women's Champions League
item.description: Sam Kerr celebrates her first Chelsea start in almost two years by scoring a double, then declaring herself 100 per cent fit and "ready to go" for more game time and goals.

item.title: Drones assist researchers in studying hard-to-reach wildlife
item.description: Researchers are turning to drones to help them discover the health and habits of large marine mammals and other wildlife.

item.title: Hongqi Bridge partially collapses in southwest China just months after opening
item.description: Video has been captured of the moment a bridge in China partially collapses with the structure becoming engulfed in plumes of dust.

item.title: Menulog to stop Australian operations later this month
item.description: Food delivery company Menulog says it will cease operating in Australia in two weeks' time, prompting questions about whether Australia can maintain a competitive food delivery market.

item.title: Good chance of aurora tonight, as two-year peak solar activity nears its end
item.description: One of nature's most magnificent shows, the southern lights, could be on display for large parts of southern Australia tonight with a severe solar storm event impacting on Earth. But the boom in aurora activity will not last forever.

item.title: Coonawarra wine association apologises for 'disappointing' T-shirts
item.description: The Coonawarra Vignerons, in South Australia's South East, has deleted a post which attracted controversy for celebrating binge drinking.

item.title: Manjimup avocado growers celebrate abundance of 'unusual' avocados
item.description: Avocado growers in WA's South West say the oddly shaped fruit popping up on their trees may cause a few chuckles, but that does not affect the taste.

item.title: Can we tackle climate change without net zero? Here's what it really means
item.description: The Coalition is debating whether to dump its commitment to the net zero climate target. Here's what that term actually means.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor shuts down royal business venture Pitch@Palace
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor has applied to close down some of his last remaining business interests, weeks after he was stripped of his titles and honours.

item.title: Downsizing the Australian dream: Homebuyers adjust expectations in hot housing market
item.description: A new report finds that prospective Australian homebuyers are increasingly abandoning their dreams of a freestanding house in favour of more budget-friendly townhouses and units.

item.title: Toyah Cordingley's father gives evidence in trial of Rajwinder Singh, who is charged with murder
item.description: Toyah Cordingley's father has told a jury he paused to rest under a tree during the search for his daughter when he noticed an "odd-shaped mound" at his feet.

item.title: BHP ordered to pay miners $84,000 following Christmas holiday pay dispute
item.description: The Mining and Energy Union wins an appeal, arguing the mine operated for the pure purpose of profit over the public holiday period.

item.title: Gold Coast to host AACTA awards, festival through to 2028
item.description: An Australian film and television awards ceremony that has attracted Hollywood heavyweights, including Margot Robbie, will be held in Queensland until 2028.

item.title: Wollongong council seeks $44,000 for removing whale drowned by shark net
item.description: Wollongong City Council wants the NSW government to cover the $44,000 cost of recovering a humpback whale that drowned in a Coledale shark net.

item.title: Claims secret gas decarbonisation report 'doctored' by WA government to support net zero narrative
item.description: Last year the WA government commissioned a report on whether LNG exports to Asia were helping decarbonisation efforts — but the final report is vastly different to the draft, and analysts and activists say it has been doctored.

item.title: Australia suffers Ashes scare with Josh Hazlewood and Sean Abbott having scans on hamstrings
item.description: Josh Hazlewood's hamstring scare is not serious, but the news was less promising for fellow Ashes squad member Sean Abbott.

item.title: Louvre heist ‘detective’ Pedro talks about the inspirations behind his viral look
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Japanese ambassador calls for security 'triangle' with Australia, US
item.description: Japan's ambassador to Australia calls for the two countries to form an "equilateral" security triangle with the United States, while championing the role of gas in the clean energy transition.

item.title: Not introverted or extroverted? You could be an otrovert
item.description: Unlike extroverts or introverts, otroverts don't look outward or retreat inward to be energised.

item.title: Ben Stokes calls out 'has-beens' after criticism of England's Ashes preparations
item.description: Critics of England's truncated preparation for this summer's Ashes Test series are off the mark, according to touring captain Ben Stokes.

item.title: National mental health agreement failing, Productivity Commission finds
item.description: A scathing Productivity Commission review concludes that Australia's mental health system is failing and needs a rewrite, while warning that 500,000 Australians are unable to access the care that they need.

item.title: Protesters clash with security at COP30 climate summit in Brazil
item.description: The incident caused "minor injuries to two security staff, and minor damage to the venue," according to a spokesperson for the United Nations.

item.title: Louvre heist 'detective' Pedro reveals inspirations behind viral look
item.description: Louvre heist "fedora man" Pedro Elias Garzon Delvaux says the inspiration behind his vintage look includes Agatha Christie's famed detective Hercule Poirot and James Bond.

item.title: Australia and Indonesia strike landmark security treaty
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese declares a "new era" in the relationship between the neighbours in a joint appearance with Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto in Sydney.

item.title: Teenager faces sentencing hearing after pleading guilty to murder of Vyleen White at Ipswich shopping centre
item.description: A young girl who watched on as a teenager killed her grandmother in an act of "indiscriminate violence" at an Queensland shopping centre says the 70-year-old was not "just a nanny".

item.title: Regulator suspends use of dimethoate insecticide on berries
item.description: Australians' surging appetite for berries has prompted the national farm chemical watchdog to suspend a popular insecticide.

item.title: NSW Reconstruction Authority sells flood buyback homes for as little as $1
item.description: Eleven flood buyback homes sell without a reserve price in the NSW Northern Rivers, with more to hit the market before the end of the year.

item.title: Melbourne Cup-winning jockey Jamie Melham suspended for 30 race meetings for careless riding
item.description: History-making jockey Jamie Melham has hit the headlines for the wrong reasons, with the Melbourne Cup winner banned for 30 race meetings for careless riding that resulted in a race fall for Blake Shinn.

item.title: Recruitment data shows unemployment rate worse than official figures suggest
item.description: The October unemployment rate is crucial because it will either cement the RBA's decision to keep interest rates on hold, or cause more confusion about monetary policy. Early evidence points to a weakening jobs market.

item.title: Rainforest Reserves Australia questioned over submissions against Moonlight Range Wind Farm
item.description: Rainforest Reserves Australia has faced a Senate inquiry amid allegations of using AI and referencing non-existent projects and groups in submissions against an axed wind farm.

item.title: Two-thirds of A-League Women players experience 'psychological distress', PFA report finds
item.description: More than two-thirds of A-League Women players were in psychological distress last season, including experiencing disordered eating, alcohol misuse or disturbed sleep, according to football's players' union.

item.title: Inquest into death of Stanley Obi, allegedly set alight by former partner in murder-suicide, concludes
item.description: Stanley Obi, 33, died after his former partner Sarah Mudge set him and his then-partner alight. A coronial inquest hears he should have been asked if he was the victim of abuse.

item.title: Barcaldine Renewable Energy Zone plans abandoned
item.description: Barcaldine Shire Council says it is working with affected businesses to keep them in town after ZEN Energy pulled out of plans for a renewable energy industrial precinct.

item.title: Man found not criminally responsible for murder of Ray McCormack in Wollongong
item.description: Train station rough sleeper Aaron Michael Lord has been found not criminally responsible for the murder of Ray McCormack in a Wollongong stairwell.

item.title: Victoria's raised land taxes hurting property owners and businesses alike
item.description: Emmaly and David Gridley were shocked to learn their rural property had been mistakenly valued at $2.3 million, leaving them with a heavily inflated land tax bill.

item.title: Kyle and Jackie O escape prosecution over controversial comments during Erin Patterson trial
item.description: Victoria's Office of Public Prosecutions says it will not lay contempt of court charges against the controversial radio hosts, who made comments about the Erin Patterson case in the middle of her trial.

item.title: Historic timber Cuttagee Bridge to become double-lane concrete bridge
item.description: A single-lane historic wooden bridge on the New South Wales far south coast is set to be replaced with a concrete structure, prompting backlash from community members.

item.title: Queensland Health issues alert after three measles cases attend Jelly Roll concert at Brisbane Entertainment Centre
item.description: Queensland Health says the three infected people were at last month's concert of American singer Jelly Roll at the Brisbane Entertainment Centre and is warning others who attended to be alert for symptoms.

item.title: Four key takeaways from the Eddie Murphy documentary Being Eddie
item.description: Eddie Murphy has taken on many characters throughout his career, sometimes even within the same film. But a new documentary explores the "real Eddie Murphy" — someone the actor and comedian says few people actually know.

item.title: The world record for biggest bagpipe ensemble was broken in Melbourne, with 374 pipers playing in unison.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Bagpipers play tribute to AC/DC in world record attempt in Melbourne
item.description: The biggest ever ensemble of bagpipers gathered in Melbourne's Fed Square to play tribute to AC/DC, smashing a world record.

item.title: Macedon Ranges Mayor Dominic Bonanno caught drink driving in mayoral vehicle
item.description: Macedon Ranges Mayor Dominic Bonanno says he has been caught speeding and drink driving in his mayoral vehicle.

item.title: Tasmanian renters wanting a pet just got new protections. Here's how to get approval
item.description: Under the updated legislation, landlords now need a "reasonable" rationale to say no to a tenant having pets — and that reasonableness can only be decided by an independent tribunal.

item.title: Queensland Health warns hospitals to strengthen procedures around medical imaging results
item.description: Authorities fear some patients involved in a medical imaging bungle have suffered long-term or permanent harm due to delays in receiving scan results and follow-up care.

item.title: Sawfish found with rostrum cut off on Port Hedland beach sparks anger
item.description: A video showing a critically endangered sawfish lying dead on a beach with its saw removed is described as "cruel" and "trophy hunting".

item.title: Up to 20 Yipirinya School staff facing job losses amid 'shock' redundancies
item.description: Staff at Yipirinya School in Alice Springs say they will fight back after the school's statutory manager announced up to 20 redundancies amid plunging enrolments and a multi-million-dollar debt.

item.title: Ley to announce final position on net zero, after Liberals clear path to dump target
item.description: Months of bitter infighting between Liberals over the party's climate policy could be drawing to a close, with MPs paving the way for net zero to be formally abandoned at a shadow ministry meeting on Thursday.

item.title: WA Environmental Protection Authority gives expanded ferry network tick of approval
item.description: Western Australia's environmental regulator decides not to formally assess plans to expand Perth's ferry services on the Swan River, despite pressure from the public.

item.title: Allegations against ex-Attorney-General Mark Dreyfus removed from Linda Reynolds action against Commonwealth
item.description: Linda Reynolds is suing the Commonwealth and its lawyers over the handling of Brittany Higgins' $2.4 million compensation settlement, yet has removed specific allegations against the former Attorney-General Mark Dreyfus.

item.title: Toombul Shopping Centre site thrown lifeline after Mirvac announces sale with 'priority' to build new retail centre
item.description: Mirvac announces it is selling the site of the Toombul Shopping Centre — devastated by the 2022 Brisbane floods — to a developer who has plans to build a new shopping centre as part of a mixed-use precinct.

item.title: Abortion legislation voted down in South Australian Parliament
item.description: A new push to change South Australia's abortion laws to limit terminations after 23 weeks has been voted down in state parliament's Upper House.

item.title: Woolworths executive was hospitalised by 100-hour-a-week workload, lawsuit claims
item.description: The executive had a suspected stroke, went temporarily blind and was hospitalised five times after regularly clocking more than 100 hours a week on the job, according to documents filed with the Federal Court.

item.title: Donald Trump writes to Israel's president requesting pardon of Benjamin Netanyahu from corruption charges
item.description: Donald Trump has taken the extraordinary step of writing to Israel's President Isaac Herzog, calling on him to pardon Benjamin Netanyahu of long-standing corruption charges.

item.title: Alleged Myanmar scam kingpin She Zhijiang extradited to China from Thailand
item.description: The US has accused She Zhijiang of turning a village on the Thailand-Myanmar border into a resort city "custom built for gambling, drug trafficking, prostitution, and scams targeting people around the world".

item.title: Ukraine suspends justice minister amid corruption probe involving top figures close to Zelenskyy
item.description: After his suspension from the post of justice minister, German Galushchenko said in a Facebook post that he would defend himself in court.

item.title: Epstein alleged in private emails that Trump knew of his conduct, newly-released documents appear to show
item.description: Mr Trump has denied any involvement in or knowledge of the sex-trafficking activities of his former friend and the White House has accused Democrats of peddling a "fake narrative".

item.title: Cambodia and Thailand accuse each other of border violence amid reports of civilian casualties
item.description: Phnom Penh has accused Thai troops of killing a civilian at the border, just days after a peace deal between the two countries was paused by Thailand.

item.title: UK prime minister Keir Starmer insists team 'united' as rumours swirl of leadership challenge
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer is denying he authorised unnamed allies to brief the media about a possible leadership challenge, in a move that forced his health minister to publicly deny he was plotting against him.

item.title: Australia's first treaty with Aboriginal people set to be signed in Victoria
item.description: Victoria's first treaty with Aboriginal people will today be signed by members of the Aboriginal community, the premier and state governor.

item.title: The Liberals want to ditch net zero but IEA report says it's cheaper, cleaner
item.description: The most authoritative snapshot of where the global energy transition is going has just been released at a most opportune moment for any politician weighing which direction Australia should pursue.

item.title: Macquarie Point stadium goal at risk on eve of crucial AFL team vote
item.description: While Tasmania's MPs will pass the proposed AFL stadium through the lower house on Thursday, it's become a much tougher task ahead to win over the parliament's key upper house decision-makers.
